result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shyan M. Lipp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
15CM44, 15CM71, 15CM149, 15CM228 Cases called @ 9:21 a.m. Defendant Shyan M. Lipp in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CM44 - NC. 15CM71 - NC. 15CM228: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CM228: Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. 15CM149: Cts 1 & 2 - DRI. 15FO139 - DRI. 15FO73 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. No statement by DE. Court orders: 15CM44 - Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 15CM71 - 30 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - I/S - 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP.

 15CM228 - S/W 2 years probation concurrent w/ Ct 1 - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample to be provided. 1 day CFTS. Appeal rights given.

15CM149, 15CM71, 15CM44 & 15FO73 9:05 am cases called. Defendant Shyan M. Lipp in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi to set plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:04 p.m. Defendant Shyan M. Lipp in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $500 Cash Bond. Statement by DE's mother. Atty Szilagyi requesting lower cash bond of no more than $150 or signature bond. Court orders $200 Cash Bond.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint. DE is requesting a substitution of Judge. DA Blader is in agreement with a substitution as the DE's pending cases are with Judge Slate.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
